file_results.false_positive_reason: The code defines a custom install command for a Python package that, during installation, attempts to download a YAML configuration file from a remote URL and saves it to the user's home directory under .kafkahood/config.yaml. If the download fails, it writes a default configuration. While downloading remote resources during installation is not best practice and can be risky, this code does not execute any downloaded code, nor does it exfiltrate data or perform any clearly malicious actions. The behavior is more indicative of a package that wants to bootstrap its configuration from a central source. The flagged line is simply the setup() call, which is standard in Python packaging. The detection is likely a false positive due to the presence of remote resource fetching in the install process.

detection_points.code_snippet:
setup(
name="kafkahood",
version="0.1.1",
description="An internal Python package for Kafka configuration and streaming of topics",
author="Michael Miller",
author_email="michaelomiller98@gmail.com",
install_requires...
},
)
detection_points.full_match: * This package is overwriting the 'install' command in setup.py at kafkahood-0.1.1/setup.py:47
